textos_fuente.text: About Us — Fusion Sports | Youth Soccer & Futsal Tournaments, Showcases, and Events 0 Skip to Content HOME ABOUT US EVENTS THE DERBY THE OPEN PARTNERS CONTACT US Open Menu Close Menu HOME ABOUT US EVENTS THE DERBY THE OPEN PARTNERS CONTACT US Open Menu Close Menu HOME ABOUT US Folder: EVENTS Back THE DERBY THE OPEN PARTNERS CONTACT US Elevating the Game, Inspiring the Next Generation. We’re setting a new standard in youth soccer — one built on elite competition, unforgettable experiences, and a vision for long-term impact across the country Learn More About Us Our Mission Fusion Sports exists to deliver the highest-quality youth soccer events in the nation. We aim to inspire players, coaches, and families through competitive excellence, premium event execution, and a culture that puts passion, integrity, and community at the forefront. What We Believe At Fusion Sports, we believe youth sports are more than games — they’re defining moments. We believe in the power of competition to build confidence, in the value of structure to shape discipline, and in the importance of opportunity for every young athlete to rise, shine, and succeed. Our events are designed to inspire players, unite communities, and raise the bar across the youth soccer landscape Our Commitment We are committed to delivering first-class soccer experiences that are professionally run, intensely competitive, and deeply rewarding for players, coaches, and families. From our national tournaments to local showcases, we obsess over every detail to ensure teams leave better than they arrived — on the field and beyond. We’re here to grow the game and fuel the next generation of champions. Our Vision We envision a future where youth soccer is defined by excellence, opportunity, and community. Fusion Sports is not just creating tournaments; we’re crafting experiences that shape players' futures, elevate coaching standards, and inspire the next generation to dream bigger. Our goal is to be the driving force behind a movement that transforms youth sports into a platform for both personal and athletic growth, on a national scale Join the Movement. Build the Future. Whether you're a team, player, coach, brand, or supporter — there's a place for you at Fusion Sports. Be part of a fast-growing platform that champions excellence and creates lasting impact. Contact Us Elite Youth Soccer Events. National Reach. Local Impact. Contact Info: info@fusionsportsventures.com Scottdale, Arizona Copyright © 2025 Fusion Sports. All rights reserved. Privacy Policy | Terms of Use

Instagram Facebook-f Youtube Newsroom Media Engagement Center Welcome to the Media Engagement Center for “Fusion Fest 6th Annual Multicultural Arts Festival”  a dedicated suite of resources and tools tailored for media professionals, partner organizations, and community influencers – to elevate the FusionFest storyline, “to celebrate the people and the many different cultures that make Central Florida awesome by showcasing talents, sharing stories, driving innovation and building community based on respect and understanding”. FusionFest is a project of the Orange County Office of Arts & Cultural Affairs. RSVP for MEDIA NIGHT FusionFest Media Preview on November 13 from 6:30 to 7:30.  – featuring foods of the world and program highlight from the 2023 Fusion Fest – 6th Annual Multicultural Arts Festival. This one hour media-only event will showcase some of the culinary and cultural talent you’ll find at FusionFest and offer information for media engagement before and during the event. RSVP for MEDIA NIGHT Press Releases October 2, 2023 – FusionFest A nnounces the 2023 MYgration Film Competition Winne rs – Access Images September 27, 2023 – FusionFest  2023 MYgration Film Awards Ceremony – October 1 at Enzian Theatre September 18, 2023 – FusionFest Announces the 2023 MYgration Film Competition – Access Images Upcoming Media Opportunities November 13, 2023 – FusionFest Fest Media Preview Event – Foods of the World – Senf Plaza 6:30 to 7:30pm November 25 and 26, 2023 – Access to festival with permission to record, broadcast, or photograph event. Credentialed media will check in at the Media Welcome Center. RSVP for MEDIA NIGHT Download Center Show Your Support HASHTAGS: #FusionFest #FusionFestOrlando #ICanBeMeHere #ProudToShowMyColors About FusionFest 6th Annual Festival Join us for Fusion Fest – 6th Annual Multicultural Arts Festival, on November 25 (10am to 8pm) and November 26th (12pm to 6pm) at Dr. Philips Center for the Performing Arts – Seneff Arts Plaza (445 S Orange Ave, Orlando, FL 32801). Orlando’s Thanksgiving tradition, this FREE two-day extravaganza will draw an estimated 20,000. At FusionFest, we’re all about celebrating the rich tapestry of Central Florida’s diverse cultures with performers and presentations hailing from over 110 different cultures. Our mission is to showcase talents, share stories, drive innovation, and build a community founded on respect and understanding. Get ready to immerse yourself in a world of music, dance, food, visual arts, spoken word, games, and interactive activities. Take a look at our Media Points Doc below – with easy-to-use,  preformed descriptions of OVER 30 exciting elements of FusionFest. Promotional Graphics About FusionFest FusionFest Inc. is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization with the mission to celebrate the people and the many different cultures that make Central Florida awesome by showcasing talents, sharing stories, driving innovation and building community based on respect and understanding. FusionFest is a project of the Orange County Office of Arts & Cultural Affairs. FusionFest organizes weekly and monthly, both virtual and in-p erson, events that keep the community engaged and connected to the cultural diversity in Central Florida. We participate in parades and create dining experiences and workshops from J anuary to November. ​ FusionFest’s annual signature event is held each year on the Saturday and Sunday after Thanksgiving Day in Downtown Orlando. It’s a  free, two-day, festival that drawing 20,000 people from more than 110 different cultures to experience music, dance, food, visual arts, spoken word, games and interactive activities. Promotional Graphics Contact Media Contact- Paula Wyatt – Paula@AnythingisPoshAble.com – 321-946-6565 (Text for Rapid Reply ) ​ ​ ​ Spokesperson Terry Olson of the Orange County Office of Arts & Cultural Affairs – Download Headshot – View Bio Heritage and Cultural Organizations Engagement Kit From one nonprofit organization to another, thank you! Thank you for the important work your team is doing for the Central Florida community. Whether your mission is to – serve the underserved, elevate the message of inclusion, or illuminate the world through creativity – we’d love to help you! There are many ways to partner with FusionFest – and to elevate our collective missions. Visit Community Partnership Portal Stay In Touch : Follow Us Facebook-f Instagram Youtube Email Subscribe FusionFest Inc. 450 E. South St, Suite 345, Orlando, FL 32801 407-279-1846 hello@fusionfest.org EIN: 85-2245857 Charitable Solicitation Registration #CH64442 A copy of the official registration and financial information may be obtained from the Division of Consumer Services by calling Toll-Free 800-435-7352 within the State. Registration does not imply endorsement, approval, or recommendation by the State. Copyright © 2025 FusionFest Inc. All Rights Reserved. Instagram Facebook-f Youtube

Fusion Festival 2025 Deutsch English Fusion Festival 2025 TAUSEND DANK FÜR EINE WUNDERVOLLE FUSION 2025! <3 Wir haben die Zeit mit euch allem auf unserem Wunderacker sehr doll genossen und freuen uns schon wahnsinnig auf die nächste Gelegenheit. Das Fusion Festival 2026 findet vom 24.-28. Juni statt. Du willst wieder dabei sein? Dann melde dich am besten bei unserem Newsletter an, um keine Neuigkeiten zu den Tickets zu verpassen! Wenn dies länger als ein paar Minuten dauert, kontaktiere uns bitte.

Commencement Contact Us The Institute of Creative and Media Arts / Events / FusionFest FusionFest Tiffin University proudly welcomes high school and college pop, rock, funk, jazz and contemporary instrumental groups for an educational and noncompetitive festival held on the TU campus February 28th and 29th, 2024. You and your ensemble are invited to join other groups from around the region and a team of outstanding guest artists and clinicians for performances and workshops, as well as enjoy a performance by Da Land Brass Band from Cleveland, OH.  Members of Da Land Brass Band and TU faculty will also serve as clinicians for your ensemble. Drew Parent Drew is on staff at TU as the Director of Bands and Instructor of Percussion. He has been teaching and performing around the midwest for over fifteen years with regional jazz ensembles, orchestras, percussion ensembles and commercial music groups.  He has served as assistant marching band director at Trine University and drumline director at Bowling Green State University, University of Toledo, and Central Michigan University. He has also taught and arranged percussion for many successful high school marching band programs in the Midwest that include Maumee High School, Springfield High School, Angola High School, Carroll High School, and Lake Orion High School. Currently performing around the region as both a drummer and bass player, he holds both music education and performance degrees from Saginaw Valley State University and Central Michigan University. Dan Myers Dan Myers serves as Assistant Professor of Commercial Music at Tiffin University.  Dan is an active composer, songwriter and multi-instrumentalist and writes music for film, television and the stage, and his original songs can be heard in major motion pictures, animation, and network television series. As a member of actor Gary Sinise’s Lt. Dan Band, Dan has enjoyed the privilege of dueling on fiddle with Charlie Daniels at the Kennedy Center, performing for U.N. troops in Afghanistan and Kuwait, and debuting new music at the Ravinia Festival. Dan tours nationally with his Indie-folk band Stolen Silver, which has been featured in the New York Times, Chicago Tribune, and American Way Magazine. Dan holds a Bachelor of Music degree in Jazz Studies from Western Michigan University and a Master of Fine Arts in Music Composition for the Screen from Columbia College. 2024 Tiffin University FusionFest Ensemble Registration Pre-registration for your ensemble(s) will be accepted until Friday February 23rd, 2024 or until all available time slots are full. Please fill out this form one time for each ensemble participating. For a second ensemble, re-load this page to refresh the form. FusionFest 2024 Registration Register now! Our performing, visual and media arts ensembles span a wide variety of styles,​ ​projects and interests, and are open to all undergraduate students on the Tiffin campus. From exciting Orlando festivals, family-friendly fairs, and seasonal holiday events to local story times, free community activities, and weekend fun across Orange, Seminole, Osceola, Lake, and Volusia counties, our calendar makes it easy to plan memorable outings. Whether you’re looking for kid-friendly events, indoor play, outdoor adventures, or special attractions like theme park happenings, our Central Florida events calendar Images by Blue Sunglass Photos With our Orlando Family Events Calendar , you can easily filter events by category to find exactly what fits your family’s needs. Browse holiday celebrations, free and low-cost events, back-to-school activities, seasonal festivals, and so much more. You can also filter by venue, city, cost, or even check out our featured events to quickly discover what’s happening near you. You can view listings by the day to plan their schedule, flip through different days to explore new opportunities, or switch to the monthly calendar view for a big-picture look at everything happening across Orlando and Central Florida. If you’re hosting a family-friendly event, you can even submit it directly to our calendar here . Want to have events and news deliverd to your inbox, click here to sign up for our weekly newsletters! Be sure to always double and triple check dates, times, and details of any event before heading out, as event producers may make last-minute changes without notifying us, and occasional errors may occur when loading events into the calendar. « All Events This event has passed. Event Series: FusionFest Downtown Orlando « Christmas Season at Santa’s Christmas Tree Farm Super Awesome Cool Pottery’s Family Wheel Class » FusionFest Downtown Orlando 11/30/2024 @ 10:00 am - 8:00 pm free November 30-December at Seneff Plaza Downtown Orlando FusionFest Inc. is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization with the mission to celebrate the people and the many different cultures that make Central Florida awesome by showcasing talents, sharing stories, driving innovation and building community based on respect and understanding. FusionFest is a project of the Orange County Office of Arts & Cultural Affairs. Our signature event in Downtown Orlando is a free, two-day, festival that draws people from more than 110 different cultures to experience music, dance, food, visual arts, spoken word, games and interactive activities. Click HERE for everything happening at the event. Add to calendar Google Calendar iCalendar Outlook 365 Outlook Live Details Date: 11/30/2024 Time: 10:00 am - 8:00 pm Series: FusionFest Downtown Orlando More Information https://www.fusionfest.org/annual-festival-2024/ Venue Seneff Arts Plaza – Downtown Orlando 445 S Magnolia Avenue Orlando , FL 32801 United States + Google Map Related Events Baby Babbles at Maitland Library September 11 @ 10:30 am - 11:00 am Town of Oakland Story Time on the Porch September 11 @ 10:30 am - 11:00 am Youth Workshop at The Kitchen House September 11 @ 10:30 am - 1:00 pm « Christmas Season at Santa’s Christmas Tree Farm Super Awesome Cool Pottery’s Family Wheel Class » Thank you for visiting us at MyCentralFloridaFamily.com. We're happy you're here! This website was designed to assist families with finding resources, ideas and things to do within the Central Florida community. We encourage all families to check and double check all events, information and news prior to making decisions for their families because, while we strive for perfection, information, news, events, and details always will and do change. Our website contains paid, non-paid, and in-trade mentions, articles, and reviews of organizations, events, schools and businesses throughout Central Florida. These mentions are for informational purposes only and should not be considered an endorsement. Please do further research on your own before choosing an event, organization, school or business to engage with. Families and individuals using our site assume all risks from any activities they participate in. MyCentralFloridaFamily.com, Epic Expos, Inc., their employees and owners are not responsible for any injuries or issues that come from participating in any of the events or opportunities listed on our website or social pages. All users/readers/visitors to MyCentralFloridaFamily.com agree to hold Epic Expos, Inc. and all of it's entities harmless in any such claims. The New Era of The Esports Centre Skip to main content Skip to navigation Sign in Study Research Business Alumni News Engagement Search Warwick Search Warwick Esports Centre Get involved PC bundles Fusion Fest UX Testing Group experience School bookings Team Experiences News Contact Location Fusion Fest Fusion Fest TUE 5TH MARCH SAVE THE DATE! FUSION FEST: A NEW ERA We were delighted to launch Fusion Fest on Tuesday 5th March, an action packed day of activity and a celebration of our brand new Esports Centre situated on the main Piazza, Rootes Building right next to the SU, Arts Centre and main campus-based amenities. Fusion Fest featured a full day programme for students, staff and the general public and included staff competitions, society takeovers and plenty of opportunities for attendees to play and test out our high-spec gaming equipment. The programme of activity included: FESTIVAL SCHEDULE 11am-1pm – FESTIVAL OPEN Free Play on PC’s, Consoles & Racing Sims HADO (Rootes Restaurant) Racing Society Takeover 1pm-3pm – Staff Esports Lunch Break The New Era – Opening talk with Esports Centre manager Kirk Hastings Staff Typing Tournament Staff Racing-Sim Fastest lap challenge Staff Casual Consoles/ Board Games HADO (Rootes Restaurant) 2:30pm-5pm - Society Takeovers Nintendo Society: Console Zone Esports Society: PC Zone(s) Motorsport Society: Racing Arcade Zone HADO (Rootes Restaurant) 4pm – Warwick v Waterloo: Rocket League Varsity Watch on the BIG screen HADO (Rootes Restaurant) 5pm – VIP Event Arrival/ Welcome Activity Event Attendees can enjoy: PC’s Consoles Racing Sims Board Games Hado (Rootes Restaurant) *Please note the centre will be closed to regular patrons 6pm-9pm due to the VIP launch event taking place* 9pm-11pm – Centre officially Open AN ACTION PACKED DAY OF ACTIVITY! Free Play Visitors played on our gaming equipment for free. and experienced the ease of use and the quality of hardware the Esports Centre has to offer. HADO Visitors experienced HADO, a team sport played with up to three people on each team using head-mounted displays and armband sensors. Each game lasted 80 seconds, with the ultimate goal being the team with the most points at the buzzer winning. Staff Casual Consoles/ Board Games University staff engaged in casual console and board game session with games such as FIFA, MarioKart and Switch Sports. Staff Fastest Lap Challenge University staff took part in competitions on our Racing Sims with the aim of setting the fastest lap around the track. These are some of the best racing sims available for commercial use and visitors certainly felt the power of true force feedback. Staff Typing Tournament Staff took part in group typing challenges against their fellow University of Warwick colleagues Society Takeover Racing, Esports, Nintendo & Motorsport societies got together as they took over a section of the Centre running game-related activities. Waterloo V Warwick We partnered with the University of Waterloo (Canada) to bring a new international varsity. Warwick Esports Society's Rocket League team. Spectators watched on our big screen as we took on the Waterloo team! Join today Opening times During the Summer Holidays: Esports is only open for event bookings or email us for a group booking Location Fusion Sports Bar, Rootes Building, First floor, University of Warwick, Coventry, CV4 7AL Connect Esports Centre on Twitter Esports Centre on Instagram Send us a message Page contact: Web Editor Last revised: Wed 6 Mar 2024 Powered by Sitebuilder Accessibility Cookies © MMXXV Modern Slavery Statement Student Harassment and Sexual Misconduct Privacy Terms Work with us Let us know you agree to cookies We use cookies to give you the best online experience. Contact Us | Meet Fusion Skip to content Menu Home Relationships Dating Manifestation Reviews secret text messages Menu Home Relationships Dating Manifestation Reviews secret text messages Contact Me Welcome to our blog, MeetFusion, and thank you for visiting our contact us page. To get in touch with us, simply fill and submit the form below, and we’ll get back to you ASAP. At MeetFusion, we pride ourselves on being the ultimate resource for dating and relationship advice. While we’re no relationship experts or gurus like Steve Harvey or Dr. Phil, we’ve learned a few things from our dating and relationship experiences, and we’ve curated all that information to help you avoid some of our painful mistakes and experiences. To that end, we have an open communication policy and encourage our readership to get in touch with us if they have any burning questions that need to be answered. We’re also open to suggestions from our readership, so if there’s an interesting topic you’d like to see covered, then be sure to let us know. And if you’re a copywriter looking to get a guest post featured on our blog, then be sure to use the form below to get in touch with us. While we may have strict editorial guidelines, if your content suggestion adheres to our content guidelines, then we’d be more than happy to feature you on our blog. That being said, be sure to look through our already published content to see if we’ve already featured your topic suggestion on our blog to avoid wasting everybody’s time. We will do our best to answer all your questions within a 48-hour window. However, if you don’t hear back from us within a couple of days, then be sure to shoot us another email because yours might have fallen through the cracks.
